thread.title: CLAREMONT: Explore nature at night at Rancho Santa Ana Botanic Garden
thread.title_full: CLAREMONT: Explore nature at night at Rancho Santa Ana Botanic Garden - Press Enterprise

author: TIMOTHY GUY
title: CLAREMONT: Explore nature at night at Rancho Santa Ana Botanic Garden
text:
BY TIMOTHY GUY / STAFF WRITER
Published: Oct. 20, 2015 11:14 p.m. CLAREMONT: Explore nature at night at Rancho Santa Ana Botanic Garden Print Photo Share Pin It More Galleries ADVERTISEMENT Opossums will be a part of Rancho Santa Ana Botanic Garden’s annual “Things That Go Bump in the Night” event. , COURTESY OF STEFANIE NUNEZ Related article » Not all the things that go bump in the night are terror-inducing.
Forget The Bogeyman and Freddy Krueger, we’re talking about real life. The Rancho Santa Ana Botanic Garden’s annual “Things That Go Bump in the Night” event will show families that the creatures of the night aren’t that scary after all. The two-night event, Friday and Saturday, Oct. 23-24, at the Claremont gardens will showcase animals such as wolves, opossums, spiders and owls. Guests will get a chance to get up close and personal with petting the wolves.
The event will also feature a show featuring parasitic insects. It is suggested that families bring their own flashlights as lighting at the gardens is limited. The Lobos Food Truck will be on hand to offer up burgers, salads and mac and cheese.
5:30-9 p.m. Friday-Saturday, Oct. 23-24, Rancho Santa Ana Botanic Garden, 1500 N. College Ave., Claremont. $5-$10, free for children three and younger. 909-625-8767 ext. 224, rsabg.org .
Contact the writer: features@pe.com
